alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 21 at 9:49PM MST until February 24 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TUESDAY TO 11 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mountain snow and some blowing snow likely, along with a prolonged period of dangerous wind chills. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 20 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 MPH. Wind chills as low as 30 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Snowy and Sierra Madre mountain ranges, mainly above 9000 feet elevation. * WHEN...Winter Storm Warning until 11 AM MST Tuesday. Wind Chill Advisory from 11 AM MST Tuesday until 11 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Mountain travel will be extremely dangerous or impossible due to icy, snow packed roads and very low visibilities in falling and blowing snow. Outdoor recreation could be life threatening to those caught unprepared for severe winter conditions. Dangerously low wind chills could lead to frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Hypothermia can develop quickly if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
